name: Hell Yeah! Wrath of the Dead Rabbit
description: A crazy action-adventure platformer... In Hell.
minimum_requirements: OS: Vista/Win7 Processor: Intel Core 2 DUO @ 2.4 GHz/Athlon 64 X2 4200+ & above Memory: 1 GB RAM (2 GB on Vista) Graphics: DirectX 10 compatible graphic card with at least 512 MB RAM DirectX®: 10 and above Hard Drive: 2 GB Sound:

reviews.review_text: *English*     Platformer full of humor, completely nuts and incredibly fun.
Do you like rabbits? Especially those crazy and dead? If your answer is 'yes' this game is for you....What are you waiting? Buy it!

In the spirit of joining my fellow SEGA Nerds teammates, I decided to join the Annual SEGA Horror Fest with a review. While I may not be the most appropriate person to talk about Halloween, since we don’t celebrate it in my country, I tried to choose a title that’s more related to our “Día de los Muertos” (Day of the Dead), our national holiday that embraces our joy for life, the cult and nostalgia for our departed ones and also… to poke fun at death.  Precisely, that’s what Arkedo’s Hell Yeah! Wrath of the Dead Rabbit does, poke fun at death, hell, and some other spooky things on the way. While French developers, Arkedo, might be long gone as a studio after a financial bankruptcy (should I dedicate a Mexican Día de los Muertos “Ofrenda” perhaps?), they certainly made games that were appreciated in a special way by some people (like Nervous Brickdown or Big Bang Mini for the Ninty DS).  A RESURRECTION FOR A PLATFORMER?   For a start Hell Yeah! is a platformer, a genre that many thought dead but that’s been slowly coming back thanks to the necromancy of retro gaming. You control Ash, hell’s current underworld ruler, who is trying to hunt down some of his minions that are threatening him with releasing compromising photos to the public. As fun and weird as the plot sounds this translates into comedic and bizarre interruptions or mini games that appear as you progress though mazes in the underground, perhaps this is a double edge sword, cause while some of us SEGA fans might fall into the gag and follow by, some others might get desperate trying to know what’s going on, because the game is not very intuitive in explaining these “on the go” mechanics. For example, some bosses require to aim and shoot as a mini game, but some people might not get how to do it, cause the game does not do a very good job on explaining so or that it is part of a gag.  For most, the game has a lot of fun to offer, but also requires to master some skill, since the controls require you to switch between sticks to aim for certain parts or to zoom out the screen to aim and hit some enemies.  SOMETHING FOR THE SEGA FANS  The game has a lot of fanservice for the average SEGA fans. As you progress in the game you unlock SEGA Character themed add-ons like JSR or Shinobi hats or items, you can also equip your attacking wheel with more weapons or features. There are also other fun hubs like your own island were you send your defeated enemies and punish them as it must due!  A KILLER OST AND VISUALS TO DIE FOR  There are 2 things that outstand in this game, its vector based visuals & character designs and its amazing OST. The vector artwork shines so well in this game and allows you to enjoy the aesthetics no matter the resolution, specially in PC, Arkedo did a great job. The OST is something to enjoy on its own, even if you don’t buy the game you can still download this awesome score, it has something for almost everyone, from lullabies to hardcore punk, and every tune fits perfectly in the game.  SUMMARY  This game is fun and enjoyable, but might not be appropriate for the narrow minded player. While its true that pretty visuals and a good OST are not all in a game, the title lacks of some areas to be polished like a more polished gameplay and controls.  Pros:  + Amazing visuals and OST + Fanservice for the SEGA fans + Fun times and fart-type jokes  Cons:  – Not for everyone – Requires control skill – Lacks of explanation for some mechanics
This is the epitome of fun, brainless platformers. No stupid unnecessary stuff, no ludicrous mechanics. Just pure fun.

its a fun game with crunchy comedy, you're ash the prince of hell with annoying quest search for the bad guy who publish your photo while bathing with duck. with not so chalenging puzzle, beautiful graphics and a lot of amazing features like unique kill scene, this game is worth to play.
A rabbit that ♥♥♥♥s up people in hell... I nominated it for farm animal wtf?

This is a weird one. 2D platformer/action hybrid, with a ridiculous over the top presentation style - think the cast of Disgaea but played by rabbits make a 2D side scrolling action platformer with 100 mini-bosses to destroy & enslave for your monster Island factory. And hats. Each mini-boss is taken down in a different QTE mini-moment (think seconds of play & flash style over the top sequences as a result).  I love it so far. I expect to hit a difficulty spike & change that opinon, but so far, I'm digging it. I can understand why Sega took a punt on it - there's a lot of good stuff in this one & obviously a lot of care/love from the developer.

Hell Yeah is a fun nonsensical game where you play Ash the undead crown rabbit prince of hell, who has had a picture taking of his softer side with his bath toy. As the Crown Prince of hell the only option is obvious. You need to kill everyone who saw the picture on Hellnet! With a wide arsnal of weaponry an awesome 'jetpack' (Which is the massive drill thing) and a compleatly customizable experience the game offers alot of fun to be had, you even put the boss characters you have kill to work on a save like island paradise! You really should own this game, it is alot of fun!
Elavator music when loading  10/10 would load again to the next stage Thank you SEGA, i love you bbyz

I'd had this game sitting in my library for a good long while, and i sort of ignored it. Just recently, though, i was going through my games that i hadnt played in a while (or not at all) and i came across this game. I'd played it a tiny bit before and didnt give it a fair chance so i played it again. WOW, this agme is good. The dialougue and art style are amazing, the controls are tight, the feeling is correct for the setting (comically morbid) and the overall gameplay is fantastic. Everything is perfect, and theres not much else to say. I would give this game a 10/10, but it deserves at least 11/10. Thank you for making this.

It's funny, cute, adorable, chiming with grit and bloody violence, and has absolutely wonderful art for a game of this genre. The music is a little slow for my tastes, needs more BPM in my opinion but that's just me. Nice little jem.
If you want to be a murderous bunny with a jetpack that slices everything in his path then this the game for you otherwise it will leave a fleshwound in your heart. Enough said

This game is totally of it's rockers, mental and completely bonkers!!! And I've only used 2 crazy words to make me sound hip with the kids here. If anything, it's back from the Earth Worm Jim style of gaming, sega's golden days... screw logic, give me a protagonist that is silly in theory, and looks totally badass in action!!! HELL YEAH!!!
I rate it rabbit stew out of chicken noodle soup.

A surprisingly fun game with very basic metroidvania aspects. Avoid the DLC though, one is just customization options and the other is brief 'missions' that do little more than draw attention to the game's biggest flaws.
Insane and fun, must play and great price (free)
A game that 2D but can make a perfect combo if you know to play, also it could kill all the stupid monters and it call Hell Yeah MTF DEAD RABBIT !!!
this game is so blood thirsty and fun XD

You play as the Dead Prince of hell. ( Ash - The cute little bunny) You are on a mission to kill strange creatures in the bloodiest ways to get your embarassing dirty pictures back.   Alot of fun and pretty short, Has a lot of personality and alot of thought went into the humor that was in the game. Subtle things like 'Elevator music' when loading the game makes it great.   Would I recommend this game.... HELL YEAH! (see what I did there)
Story (No Spoiler)

This game almost killed me. Srsly. Don't drink water while playing! Risk of choking.   But anyway it's hilarious. I love the art style, music, story and characters. It was so fun to play I would gladly forget it and play again.

Absolute awesome this game. It has a very funny humor, lots of weapons while not too many and allot of other guddies. Well it is a sidescrooler what do I need you to tell? But there are some different levels in it as well as allot of nice ideas. So I dunno what to tell you about other than get this game if you like sidescrowlers.
This might be the only time a game's name is also whether or not I would recommend this game to other people.  Hell Yeah!
I gambled all my money at the casino 10/10
good fun love it simple is good
Best game and funny! Good art and very almost. Recommend!!
Hell Yeah is a 2D platformer. Me personally very caught. Processing of the game is very pleasing both graphically and playable :) Definitely one has the opportunity to try out! :) 8/10
It fun It rock
A realy nice game, addictive, extremely funny, good kind of humor, will recommend the game! :)
10/10 would deffo get killed again by crazy patrick star with 10 boobs
Bunnies, Death, Carnage 10/10
It's annoying as ♥♥♥♥.
You've killed all those monsters so.. So? Was it fun? Hell Yeah!
Hell Yeah maybe ᕕ༼(o ͜ ʖ͡°༽ل͟ ຶ°ʖ͡°༽͡ ͡ °)ᕗ sega ear ♥♥♥♥ at start and no shift + tab so rip thoses things but stil gud

Hell Yeah! Wrath of the Dead Rabbit is a very odd one, i find enjoyment in the game for its 2D shooting platforming style, humor is childish at times (poop monsters, ect) but overall has some cool minigames for killing minibosses, minibosses are reused but you cant expect ALL 300+ to be unique but most are unique.
VERY VERY NICE GAME!! a bit boring with keyboard but I enjoy playing it with controller... Never trust a Rabbit again :D

An excellent platformer/shmup with a fun story and great humor. The minigames are fun and rarely repetitive, boss fights challenging and require reflexes and tactics while the minibosses are varied and sometimes require thinking out of the box :D
One of thje best platformer ever. I don't understand the low metacritic score at all. Seriously GET IT!
what else can u say but Hell Yeah! surprisingly entertaining

Pretty fun game, very much a platformer kind of like a Mario type of game with some puzzle elements. Not too difficult but some of the spots can be kind of frustrating, but then again you wouldn't be in hell if that wasn't the case...

Solid platformer that's reminiscent of the Jazz Jackrabbit series, and not because they're both about rabbits! Filled with rocking music and truly WTF random minigame moments, as well as fourth wall breaking humor, this is one to put on your radar.
Best game I've played in a long while.
What the hell did I play? This is why you gotta love indies. This is a mess of a story game, that is all the more fun because of how crazy it is. 8/10
A pretty good game tbh. Funny too
its okay, its full of strange quirks but i got it for free so it wasn't a bad pickup but the comedy is quite corny, almost childish
[Insert a stupid joke about the title of the game] Just buy it if you can, pretty fun :3
fund and awesome game, i totally recommend it.

Great, irreverant fun. Not very difficult, but still challenging enough to be interesting.  Pros: -Good writing with lots of meta humor that really works, as well as just lots of silliness in general. Quite charming! -Graphics are charming and enjoyable -Good controls -Satisfying and very varied finishers for bosses and sub-bosses  -Sega references galore, and THEY USE THE 1991-1995 SEGA CHORUS FROM CLASSIC SONIC GAMES  -Music is decent -You can put your victims to work on a... resort island in hell. You become their HR manager, essentially, and keeping them happy and productive nets you food (health items), money, bonuses and more. It's kinda its own game within the game and I can see people easily getting attached to that half.   Cons: -Not a problem for myself, but some people may be turned off by the crude humor (I think there is a menstruation joke, but I wasn't quite sure. The nurse character? Anyone else?) -Level layouts sometimes seem haphazard and not really planned. (Not a major issue for me, and I'm about an hour in at this point)

a great twin stick platformer. its pretty repeative but very fun gameplay and puzzles all the way through where yo'll need to kill the guys in each zone then do a mini game to finish them. you'll repeat a lot of finishers but when they are all pretty funny. i really suggest this game but not at $15. buy on a slight sale as its worth $10ish

As of when I played this, SEGA made the game free for the 'Make war, not love' event they're having. I'm so happy I got this game, and I wouldn't mind paing for it if it wasn't free. This is a great game and I would recommend to anyone who loves 2D Castlevania/Metroid/Mega Man styled game. The game's art style and humour is brilliant too.

Jazz Jackrabbit in hell! What more do you middle aged Amiga fans need? Great graphics, great controls! I am off to sound like my 12 year old son. The first weapon is soooo OP!! Grab some 20/20 and have some good old platforming fun! In an early 90s styleey the game is Radical, Fresh & Bodacious dudes!

First, sorry for my bad grammar. I usually don't like this type of game. But this game is different. It's offer you unique gameplay. It'll keep surprising you,, From sea to space, Great theme song, challenge, joke, cameo and Gore.  The story and environment is a bit like Disgaea.. The art was cool though.. And not recommended for under 17 age though..

Probably one of my favorite indie titles by Sega! (and on Steam). This game is funny and outrageously challengingly bad ♥♥♥! I enjoyed every second of the platforming and gun mechanics, its insanely enjoyable! I was also massively surprised by the customization and extra content in the game. Being able to make bosses/monsters your personal work slaves is evil good and neat to see! Arkedo Studio really pushed out a great game. Man i wish I could have discovered this earlier during its 2012 launch, dang.
I wouldn't call it amazing, but it can be a fun and quick game to playthrough.
Is it worth 15 bucks? probably not. Will you die from laughing at everything you encounter, Yup XD
This is a great short platformer. Its funny and it doesn't overstay its welcome.
I didn't expect SEGA, a company who makes child-friendly games, to make a game with this much adult humor. Still a great, addicting, and creative game though!
I absouloetly reccomend this game,other from a ♥♥♥♥ sheep in a jail zone beating the ♥♥♥♥ out of you. Even thought it looks laggy,it works fine on my toaster. 9/10.
Dead rabbit... killing foes the goriest way as possible...  For a platformer, it is quite good!  Do I recommend? Hell Yeah!

Awesome arcade-y old-school platformer with a ton of references to modern and retro gaming culture and good sense of humor. Semi-open world jump'n'run mixed with new gimmicky gameplay elements. Hidden gem!

Well this game is super over the top. You play Ash a skeletal rabbit who happnes to be lord of hell. He is caught bathing with a ducky toy and labeled a ♥♥♥♥♥ by some demons, so now you have to get the picture back and kill anyone who has seen the picture. What follows is a mess of over the top attacks and a funny story. Everytime you finish a strong enemy or a boss you can use a finisher which seems to change every single time, I once had one where I unleashed a barrage of carrot shaped missles. I got this game for cheap (on sale or coupon cannot remember) so I say if you are into this type of game go ahead and buy it at full price, if you're on the fence wait for a sale.
Best game if your doing nothing and it so fun

As someone who grew-up durring the 80's, I spent a lot of time playing side-scrollers, so even before you take in the weird-♥♥♥ characters, the setting and even the dialog, this game just takes me back to my gaming roots.

At first I thought this game was a try-hard. This game turned out to be one of the most fun games I've ever played! Kill scenes are amazing, talks are funny and it's quite entertaining. This game rocks!
Hilarious game. You will not regret playing it
Fun and action-packed!
If(You want to be a devil rabbit that is the ruler of hell){  Play The Game; }else{  Play The Game Anyway; }

Great, irreverant fun. Not very difficult, but still challenging enough to be interesting.  Pros: -Good writing with lots of meta humor that really works, as well as just lots of silliness in general. Quite charming! -Graphics are charming and enjoyable -Good controls -Satisfying and very varied finishers for bosses and sub-bosses  -Sega references galore, and THEY USE THE 1991-1995 SEGA CHORUS FROM CLASSIC SONIC GAMES  -Music is decent -You can put your victims to work on a... resort island in hell. You become their HR manager, essentially, and keeping them happy and productive nets you food (health items), money, bonuses and more. It's kinda its own game within the game and I can see people easily getting attached to that half.   Cons: -Not a problem for myself, but some people may be turned off by the crude humor (I think there is a menstruation joke, but I wasn't quite sure. The nurse character? Anyone else?) -Level layouts sometimes seem haphazard and not really planned. (Not a major issue for me, and I'm about an hour in at this point)
Very fun very stupid game! LOL
if you have the time it's a really good game.  can tell just by playing it for 5 mins.  too bad i get bored really fast with all games

Really fun little action side scroller with some (so far) mild adult humor in it, it was free with a few other sega classics awhile back. If you can get it for .99c sale I would definentely recommend it.
'Ash is the best SEGA character to date.'  -In-game Trivia  Hell Yeah! this is the best 2D platformer in a long time.
This game is great , srsly but I Think its not worth 12$.

I already played this on Xbox 360 before and its a fun, overlooked game. Controls are a b**** sometimes and the gameplay could have been more varied but it looks pretty and there is lots of blood so I don't care much. Plus it was free on Steam :)

Bought this game from gamersgate for a few bucks and played 24 Min (as of this review) and I must admit this game is extremely fun, demonic,strange,cool and a total blast!. Wife even said she likes watching me play. Money well spent. I haven't had this much fun with this genre of game since Jazz Jackrabbit back in the 90's. even much more fun. If you are into demonic, evil, cool, blood and guts id suggest grabbing this title IMMEDIATELY!
This game makes me laugh. It's a very fun and addicting game. It's a definite 'hell yeah!!' playing it. Definitely give it a try if you have not tried it yet.
This game is just amazing.  If you want some hard, funny and full of references platformer then 'Hell Yeah!' is best choice.  Just amazing... 11/10
10/10 would buy for a friend. It's a cool game that delivers unique experience. Fun as hell!

Hell Yeah!..... Whats can you really say about this game other than if your a crazy, nutter and can compete with all out randomness then this is for you! Alhough this isnt the best 2D graphical game, the gameplay more than makes up for it! With all the funny/rage making minigames to kill any of the monsters you encounter, they all have their own background! You will need to KILL THEM ALL! to succeed further into the game.  You may find yourself saying......WTF!? quite often but that is this games personality and great humour! You definitely need to experience this kind of game for yourself to see how addicting it truly is!
Fun, creative, and totally radical gameplay ecperience. Unlike any conventional platformers, this game includes GUNS! BUZZSAW JETPACKS! MONSTERS! *ahem* Just to name a few. Would play again.

I'm not a giant 2D platform gamer but this game is really something, the visuals are off the chang and it really brings something new with all the light comedic kill animations and overall dialogue. Would Highly recommend to any gamer wanting a fun time!

Some of my favorite games are full of personality while still remaining fun. Hell Yeah! makes it on that list. While there are games that do it better, and $15 is a bit much, its still a fun game that I think should be played
'I'm a big star, now...'

I'm not a giant 2D platform gamer but this game is really something, the visuals are off the chang and it really brings something new with all the light comedic kill animations and overall dialogue. Would Highly recommend to any gamer wanting a fun time!

This game is a must play. Why? Because of it's very classic gameplay that is attractively simple yet complex. But the biggest reason to play this game is its amazing goofy, slapstick and gory humor. You are guaranteed to play this game for hours on end, and you will be entertained every minute of the long hours you put into it. This game does not have the recognition it deserves. It is a timeless entertainer.

Hell Yeah! What else could I say to that friggin hell of a game?! It is one of the funniest and craziest jump'n'runs I've ever played. It features a good soundtrack, an enjoyable 'story'/setting, nice boss encounters (which sadly become a bit repetitive after a while) and a somehow innovative minigame island. Buying that game is strongly recommended, especially if you can get it for free like me during the Sega-Giveaway on Steam. :D
This game is ♥♥♥♥ing awesome!!!If only there would make more games like this.
The textbook definition of 'trying too hard'.
Really nice game. Really good game mechanics and really fun dialog.
You ride around on a jetpack chainsaw with a minigun and rocket launcher, travelling through the depths of hell to murder everyone who laughed at your nudes. I can relate
Is this game worth? HELL YEAH! (Only if it's on sale)
The story of the game is really funny, also the gameplay is good too If you want to play something to kill the time this is your best option
Awesome action platformer, full of dark humor. It also has great soundtrack, I'd pay 5 euros for it. 10/10

If WarioWare and Conker's BFD got together to make a metroidvania you'd probably get this game. Though the platforming sucks and there's a lot of backtracking I generally recommend it, but it's not fun enough to keep going back to it (and I don't see myself replaying it)

I went from having no idea what this game was (got it in a Humble Bundle) to slaughtering my way through the varied depths of hell.  Another Metroidvania, only with a circular saw 'jet pack' that's armed to the metal teeth, but will require a good amount of platforming skills in order to rack up the kills needed to progress. There's a little bit of a resource management minigame added in for those who just might happen to want it.
One of the most fun games I have ever played. Highly recommend it!

A rabbit on a jetpack that has spiky things, going around killing other monsters. What else do you want? Fun minigames during boss fights.  Platformer, works 'ok' with mouse and keyboard, e.g. mouse4 and mouse5 not showing up ingame, leading to 'fuzzy' description on key sequences to press during some minigames. (Hower, one becomes good at guessing them).

At the end of the day, Hell Yeah! is a disappointment. At its best, it is a charming action-adventure title that continuously amuses and entertains. At its worst (which it often is), the game devolves into mindless shooting and clumsy platforming - downfalls that overshadow any aspects of the game I actually enjoyed. 6.5/10.

More of a test in psychological mettle than a fun pastime, Hell Yeah! is just one of those games that I vastly dislike, but just need to finish; Not for a sense of accomplishment, but just so I can say that I have the will power and pain threshold to survive this train wreck. The groan-worthy self-referential humor, poor 360 controls (playing with the keyboard and mouse is inherently better, so why even make using a controller an option?), nearly infuriating bosses/mini-games, a camera that is panned much too close (if the enemies are off screen, they can't be shot), constant need for backtracking, and incredibly horrific platforming are just a few chapters in Hell Yeah!'s grimoire of wretched gaming.  The worst part about it all is that I enjoy the basic concept. It's completely lost on this unfocused ludicrousness. If the art direction were more palatable and refined a bit (right now I'd describe the level appearances as borderline 5 year old, sugar rush, fever nightmare. Especially the 'Cute' and 'Club' levels), some of the mini-games a bit more clear and not detrimental to your health bar upon failure, and just one writer at Sega or Arkedo had a likable sense of humor, this game would be a sleeper hit.   It would have been a gem if they could have blended Metroid-vania level design with fun Warioware style mini-games to break the flow.   But no. This game bombards your brain with idiotic dialogue, collectibles that are a chore to collect, and brings you so very close to liking it before it curb stomps your hopes and enthusiams for it to be at least a mediocre game. It's almost a crime to put out something that could have just used 2 or 3 more months of development and clean ups.   Maybe if Sega/Arkedo gave a rabbit's ♥♥♥ about it, they'd patch it occasionally. But will they? Hell No!

I'm not going to beat around the bush here. This game is not good, and it is quite the example of false advertising. In fact, I'd rather go to Hell than be forced to play this game again.   This game appears to be targeted to the 'I'm 14, I play Five Nights at Freddy's and I'm so edgy and random lolz rawr XD' crowd. Everything revolves around this motif. The protagonist is a cartoon skeleton rabbit that shoots his way through a Hell, flled with more cartoon animals. The artwork looks like doodles in a notebook, and the sound effects and music do not particularly fit with the theme and the concept. Listening to 'The Crunge' or 'D'yer Mak'er' on repeat for a few hours is a far more fitting soundtrack. At least the memebers of Led Zeppelin realized how ridculous these songs are, which maes them enjoyable. The game developers, however, lacked this self awareness. The unskippable and repititive dialogue (more on that in a moment) is filled with bad one liners and attempt to be funny. You know when an adult tries to be relatable and cool? This game does exactly that. In fact, I'm surprised that Hillary Clinton hasn't used it as part of her strategy to reach out to millenials (this is not a political post please don't attack me Valve mods).  The actual gameplay itself is marred by several serious flaws. The controls are incredibly awkward, and they somehow feel both stiff and slippery. It feels like someone coated the character in cold butter and threw him onto an ice skating rink. I know that WASD is not great for platformers, but it still is so strange. The rabbit has trouble dodging objects in mid air, which is something you need to be able to do well in order to advance in this game. He also seems to slide after you let go of the movement keys, which has gotten me killeed multiple times.   I tried using a controller, as the game promised controller support, but guess what? IT DIDN'T WORK. I even tried it with multiple controllers, so I am sure it is not a problem on my end. With a controller, I couldn't jump or shoot. These are the two things you need to be able to do in order to play the game. I tried remapping the buttons in the options, but it wouldn't let me. This false advertising irritates me, and I'm suprised at how many games keep doing it.  Speaking of options, the option menu is absolutely pitiful. There are two options from what I remember. These are very basic keyboard remapping (no controller for you, peasants) and the option to change the sound from stereo to mono. That's right, no opton for changing the graphics settings. The game runs at a constant 720p, and upscales to your resolution. It already looks strangely upscaled on my 1080p screen, so I'd hate to see it on a 1440p or 4K monitor.  The action in the game is very mediocre. You get to choose between a variety of weapons, such as a sawblade, a rocket launcher, grenades, and assault rifle, etc.. The only problem is, however, the game restricts weapons to specific enemies. This only raises the question: WHY EVEN HAVE WEAPON VARIETY IN THE FIRST PLACE?! It's a pitiful attempt at diversity and longevity that I cannot appreciate. The whole gimmick with the bosses is that once you defeat them, you get to play a minigame to watch a gory death animation. These come in two varieties. You get to mash a button, you you get to hit a button at just the right time. These animations are reallly just glorified quick-time events. The horse is dead far before this game stops beating it.  These issues are made even worse with the fact that there is no post hit invincibility. If this was just restricted to a certain game mode, I'd be fine with that. But, ths lack of protection makes the bad controls even worse. You can be bounced all around the map and quickly go from 250 to 0 in a matter of seconds. It is downright infuriating how cheap this game can be because of it.  The godawful cutscenes are another issue. I mentioned that they were repetitive and unskippable. I stopped paying attention because every dialogue feels the same. Ash is a teenage punk, and talks back to authority figure because he is so edgy. It gets old quick. Also, you can't skip them. You just have to mash the mouse in order to go through as quickly as possible. There isn't even voice acting. IT's just reading. I don't mind reading, but if I wanted to read, I would grab a book. Also if you die during a boss fight, which you most certainly will beause if the garbage controls. you will often be forced to go through the dialogue you just read again. This is so annoying, and I hate it when developers don't fix this issue. No one wants to read your stupid text bubbles again.  Overall, the game tries to be something that it's not. It tires to be a cool, edgy game with a unique feeling and concept, but it falls flat on its face with boorish storytelling and incompetent implementation. In fact, it eerily reminds me of Shadow The Hedghog. Both games star male animal protagonists that shoot and kill their way through dark, gritty, yet cartoony settings. They each have notoriously bad controls and serious game design issues. To give it that extra touch of cringe, both were published by none other than SEGA. You'd they they'd learn after their first try at such a game. Overall, I give it a 4/10. Maybe I'm just being too critical. After all, it is only a SEGA game that I got for free.  However, if you are one of those 14 year olds I was talking about...  10/10 edgiest game I've ever played  CRAWLING IN MY SKIN

I have no idea what I'm supposed to expect out of this game, but it sucks.   I guess they are trying to do something new with the spinsaw mechanics and fancy QTE finisher moves, but I don't really think that's good enough to make the game stand out. The graphics look nice and clean, there's some charm to the style as well but yeah, that's about it.  The major problem with this game is the level design imo. The levels are pretty barren for the most part and the enemies that you encounter are boring. Seems like you have to backtrack from time to time and that adds to the frustration.  If you are looking for a platformer, get Shovel Knight, Rayman, Freedom planet, or Shantae instead. Those are way better games imo.

A boring game that plays it safe. Not something I think I would say about a game staring a skeletal hell bunny in a buzzsaw.  The platforming is almost non-existant, the action is dull and easy, and 'bosses' that mostly float around lazily lobbing attacks in your general direction while you stand around waiting for your weapons to slowly reload. Then you kill the boss and it starts a 'wacky' wario-ware style mini game to kill it. The mini games aren't even unique to each boss, as they are pretty random and mostly make no sense to the situation.   The buzzsaw wheel was a really interesting idea, but you never seem to use it. It's almost entirly used as a key, so you can progress down the next hallway. They even make all enemies immune to it pretty quickly.   Not worth your time.

I reaaaallly want to say I love this game and recommend it, but it's hard! Jazz Jackrabbit was my favorite game ever as a pre-pubescent gamer and Hell Yeah is a most distinct rip on that style and genre, which is okay, but as far as functionality goes, there's just a bit too much going on.  Switching through weapons, even just AIMING weapons, is one of the most awkward things to do and unless I'm doing it wrong (I am using a keyboard, afterall), destroys a lot of the gameplay for me. You'll have your fingers sprawled on a hundred different things (which I know is sometimes really preferrable but ehem, not in this case) despite the fact that the game itself is fairly simple.  Some parts of the weapon/movement functionality feel entirely unnecessary, as if they have just been added to give more color to, what is essentially, Jazz Jackrabbit all over again.   But then again, it's better than 'Toxic Bunny', so like... yeah. I wouldn't personally recommend this game, purely because it just feels too awkward, but if you enjoy awkward, then maybe it's the game for you.
bad controls, unplayable with keyboard and mouse

It seems to be a fun game, but it goes the wrong way on my tastes.  the excess of color in it makes the game tiresome, and by the videos you might think it's a fast paced game, but if you ever play, you'll notice how SLOW this game really is.  The overexageration in everything in this game stop being fun and starts getting annoying and boring.  You mostly only fight bosses, there is no real fight with most enemies. you touch them with your spinning wheel and enter a 'minigame' to kill it (mostly a click repeteadly). Again, it gets boring. I mentioned earlier the game is slow. but it does get boring FAST.  Cannot recommend.
When Sega sends its games, they're not sending their best.
Edgy humor, boring soundtrack and meh plattaforming. Not worth it.

This game is what happens when a 14 year old finds his older brother's Invader Zim DVDs and begins his foray into becoming an edgelord. The writing is super cringey, with plenty of references to memes that were stale even when this game came out in 2012. The graphics are all super saturated and vibrant and you never know what to focus on, and the level layouts are that unsatisfying, Jazz Jackrabbit-esque platformer layout where you just kind of meander around a stage until it's over instead of progressing in a meaningful path. The controls are insanely floaty, like uncomfortably so, and the game's got no gamefeel to speak of. There's no impact from any of your attacks or jumps or anything, it just all feels weightless and weak. The music also just kind of drones on; it's white noise at worst, tiredvideogamemusic.mp3 at best.  That being said, some of the art assets are really nice looking. The HD sprites are appealing and some of the character designs are decent. The animation is alright too and I appreciate that they tried to make the game colorful even if they overdid it and it's hard to focus on anything.   During my 20 minutes with this game I just thought 'I could be doing literally anything else. Hm. I should go do that.'

I'm so glad I got this game free a few months ago, during a sale promoted by Sega, because this is the exact kind of game that you shouldn't spend even a dime on, it's just god-awful. You can tell it was specifically designed for controllers, since using the keyboard is really uncomfortable. Sure, you can change the controls in the menu, but the problem boils down to not being able to use the same key to both jump and drill upwards while you drive your saw-wheel-thingie.  The graphics were made using Flash, and as a result they look really cheap, the gameplay gets really repetitive too fast, it's always 'get to point X and kill Y', you do that about 50 times. The weapons are barely different from one another, the music is really obnoxious and annoying, it tries way too hard to sound 'cool'. The plot is really thin, you could argue the writers did this on purpose because this game is supposed to be 'funny', 'self-referential' and 'meme-tastic', but all the jokes fall flat and sometimes they're just plain crude. I really don't get how this game got so many good reviews.

This game does a good job of reminding me what I thought was cool when I was 9 years old. Unfortunately, I'm not 9 anymore so all the 'jokes' are just cliche. Combine that with terrrible controls and, what should just be light-hearted fun becomes just a frustrating mess. To summerize, I got this game for free and I still feel ripped off...
Silly WarioWare-esqe minigames appear whenever you kill a non-trivial enemy. While slightly humorous, they take far too long and seriously hurt the pacing of what seems like a decent platformer.
Too hard to control
A game that wants to be a metroidvania but can't quite pull it off. Many cute ideas can't obscure a fairly boring core concept that never goes anywhere.

I've owned this since release, and just this moment got around to finishing it.  At it's core it's a fun little platformer with solid 2D graphics , but the deeper into the rabbit hole you go the more tedious it becomes.   In the latter half of the game instakill spikes litter the walls, ground and ceiling. Checkpoints and healthstations can be painfully far apart, and the only real reward you get for murdering bosses is opening gates to go do more of it. The quick time events you must complete in order to kill a boss after you widdle their health down can range from simple to mind numbingly aggravating. Sometimes you'll fight a boss till you're near death only for the quicktime event to be a demanding one you've never seen before, usually ending in you failing and having to start the battle over again from the last level checkpoint.   For the most part the only reason to collect currency is to buy costumes, as most of the weapons are unlocked with story progression.  Had this actually come down in price over the 2 1/2 years since it's release I'd recommend it, but to this day apart from the odd sale it sits on the store glaring at customers for not wanting to shell out $15 for some hit and miss gameplay.   At the end of the day the tedium of the latter half of the game prevents me from recommending it for anything other than a $5 sale.

I think there are games that do a lot better what HY is just average at. I had trouble with its controlls, don't like the spongy enemies and the special attacks charge system seems redundant waste of time.  If steam had the option to choose neutral I would, but because it doesnt, HY gets negative.
Slippery and awkward controls that make the game feel like it is way more difficult it is.

Some bosses are bloody hard, it's boring. I have to repeat the conversations that can't be skipped and the ten-streets-away distance between revive spots and bosses again and again. So if you don't have too much time for game and want to have some easy fun, don't try it

I had heard that this game was either bad or good and from the tags saying it was a Metroidvania I didn't know what to believe, but after playing it I don't like it a whole lot, the mechanics of killing the stronger monsters can be annoying and there's not really a whole lot to do other than killing monsters and unlocking/buying skins and hats. Its kinda disappointing because even from what conflicting things I'd heard and the appealing art style its a little bland. If its on sale I wouldn't get it, honestly. I got it from the MWNL 3 bundle on the first day and I'm glad I didn't buy it full price. The other thing is, the VR Missions are boring for being DLC.
Very colorful and good animated, but annoying, boring and tries to shove forced comedy down your throat every second.
I forgot I had this game. I also forgot that I played it. Enough said.
It's fun for a while. Then it starts to pan out, and doesn't have enough of an incentive to keep you coming back.
